Yes, Budapest is famous for its thermal baths, which are natural hot springs that are believed to have healing properties. Here are some of the most popular ones you should consider visiting:

1. Széchenyi Baths: This is the largest and most famous thermal bath in Budapest, located in City Park. It features 15 indoor and outdoor pools, saunas, and steam rooms. The bath's architecture is stunning and features neo-baroque design.

2. Gellért Baths: This is one of Budapest's most elegant thermal baths, located in the Gellért Hotel. It features indoor and outdoor pools, saunas, steam rooms, and a variety of wellness services.

3. Rudas Baths: This is one of the oldest thermal baths in Budapest, located at the foot of Gellért Hill. It features a stunning octagonal pool that was built in the 16th century, as well as saunas, steam rooms, a rooftop pool, and a variety of massage treatments.

4. Király Baths: This is a smaller, more intimate thermal bath that dates back to the 16th century. It features indoor and outdoor pools, as well as saunas and steam rooms.

5. Lukács Baths: This is another historic thermal bath that is popular with locals. It features indoor and outdoor pools, as well as a variety of wellness services.

These are just a few of the many thermal baths in Budapest, and each one has its unique features and atmosphere. It's recommended to check their websites for more information on opening hours, admission fees, and other services they may offer.
